articles.author: Erika Fry
articles.title: Will summer kill the coronavirus?
articles.description: Coronaviruses have seasonality, but an expert says it may take years to establish precisely how weather factors into this virus’ spread.

articles.author: Alyssa Newcomb
articles.title: Indeed shuts offices in three cities over coronavirus fears
articles.description: The company has told employees in three offices to work from home after an employee's relative visited a facility for coronavirus patients.

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: ‘Vastly underestimated:’ Coronavirus outbreak may infect 500,000 in Wuhan alone before it peaks
articles.description: Currently, the true number of people exposed to the 2019-nCoV virus in Wuhan “may be vastly underestimated,” researchers at the University of Basel in Switzerland said in a study published Friday.

articles.author: Ian Mount
articles.title: For tech world’s China manufacturers, the coronavirus ‘nightmare’ may be just beginning
articles.description: Tech producers led by Foxconn, which makes the majority of the world’s iPhones a few hundred miles from the coronavirus outbreak’s epicenter, had begun preparing investors for potential bedlam.

articles.author: Karen Yuan
articles.title: Multinationals see a new coronavirus red flag on the horizon—a stronger dollar
articles.description: Economists were predicting a down year for the dollar. Then the coronavirus hit.

articles.author: Claire Zillman, reporter
articles.title: Airbnb suspends all check-ins in Beijing amid the coronavirus outbreak
articles.description: And its local rivals are following suit.
